As one put drunk into the Packet-boat,</br>Tom May was hurry'd hence and did not know't.</br>But was amaz'd on the Elysian side,</br>And with an Eye uncertain, gazing wide,</br>Could not determine in what place he was,</br>For whence in Stevens ally Trees or Grass.</br>Nor where the Popes head, nor the Mitre lay,</br>Signs by which still he found and lost his way.</br>At last while doubtfully he all compares,</br>He saw near hand, as he imagin'd Ares.</br>Such did he seem for corpulence and port,</br>But 'twas a man much of another sort;</br>'Twas Ben that in the dusky Laurel shade</br>Amongst the Chorus of old Poets laid,</br>Sounding of ancient Heroes, such as were</br>The Subjects Safety, and the Rebel's Fear.</br>But how a double headed Vulture Eats,</br>Brutus and Cassius the Peoples cheats.</br>But seeing May he varied streight his Song,</br>Gently to signifie that he was wrong.</br>Cups more then civil of Emilthian wine,</br>I sing (said he) and the Pharsalian Sign,</br>Where the Historian of the Common-wealth</br>In his own Bowels sheath'd the conquering health.</br>By this May to himself and them was come,</br>He found he was translated, and by whom.</br>Yet then with foot as stumbling as his tongue</br>Prest for his place among the Learned throng.</br>But Ben, who knew not neither foe nor friend,</br>Sworn Enemy to all that do pretend,</br>Rose more then ever he was seen severe,</br>Shook his gray locks, and his own Bayes did tear</br>At this intrusion. Then with Laurel wand,</br>The awful Sign of his supream command.</br>At whose dread Whisk Virgil himself does quake,</br>And Horace patiently its stroke does take,</br>As he crowds in he whipt him ore the pate</br>Like Pembroke at the Masque, and then did rate.

Far from these blessed shades tread back agen</br>Most servil' wit, and Mercenary Pen.</br>Polydore, Lucan, Allan, Vandale, Goth,</br>Malignant Poet and Historian both.</br>Go seek the novice Statesmen, and obtrude</br>On them some Romane cast similitude,</br>Tell them of Liberty, the Stories fine,</br>Until you all grow Consuls in your wine.</br>Or thou Dictator of the glass bestow</br>On him the Cato, this the Cicero.</br>Transferring old Rome hither in your talk,</br>As Bethlem's House did to Loretto walk.</br>Foul Architect that hadst not Eye to see</br>How ill the measures of these States agree.</br>And who by Romes example England lay,</br>Those but to Lucan do continue May.</br>But the nor Ignorance nor seeming good</br>Misled, but malice fixt and understood.</br>Because some one than thee more worthy weares</br>The sacred Laurel, hence are all these teares?</br>Must therefore all the World be set on flame,</br>Because a Gazet writer mist his aim?</br>And for a Tankard-bearing Muse must we</br>As for the Basket Guelphs and Gibellines be?</br>When the Sword glitters ore the Judges head,</br>And fear has Coward Churchmen silenced,</br>Then is the Poets time, 'tis then he drawes,</br>And single fights forsaken Vertues cause.</br>He, when the wheel of Empire, whirleth back,</br>And though the World disjointed Axel crack,</br>Sings still of ancient Rights and better Times,</br>Seeks wretched good, arraigns successful Crimes.</br>But thou base man first prostituted hast</br>Our spotless knowledge and the studies chast.</br>Apostatizing from our Arts and us,</br>To turn the Chronicler to Spartacus.</br>Yet wast thou taken hence with equal fate,</br>Before thou couldst great Charles his death relate.</br>But what will deeper wound thy little mind,</br>Hast left surviving Davenant still behind</br>Who laughs to see in this thy death renew'd,</br>Right Romane poverty and gratitude.</br>Poor Poet thou, and grateful Senate they,</br>Who thy last Reckoning did so largely pay.</br>And with the publick gravity would come,</br>When thou hadst drunk thy last to lead thee home.</br>If that can be thy home where Spencer lyes</br>And reverend Chaucer, but their dust does rise</br>Against thee, and expels thee from their side,</br>As th' Eagles Plumes from other birds divide.</br>Nor here thy shade must dwell, Return, Return,</br>Where Sulphrey Phlegeton does ever burn.</br>The Cerberus with all his Jawes shall gnash,</br>Megaera thee with all her Serpents lash.</br>Thou rivited unto Ixion's wheel</br>Shalt break, and the perpetual Vulture feel.</br>'Tis just what Torments Poets ere did feign,</br>Thou first Historically shouldst sustain.
Thus by irrevocable Sentence cast,</br>May only Master of these Revels past.</br>And streight he vanisht in a Cloud of pitch,</br>Such as unto the Sabboth bears the Witch.</br>
